alert.note: Alert for Garfield (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 2:40PM MDT until June 08 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Coulee and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following county, Garfield. * WHEN...Until 545 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 239 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause coulee and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cohagen. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
